question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Pennsylvania to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote aimed specifically at securing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially declared and carried out by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main objective of the vote must center on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be publicly disclosed through official state channels or widely recognized news outlets.

If no such vote that fulfills these criteria takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually executing it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024 (b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: No referendum officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania by the specified date, no referendum with the primary focus on abortion rights protection occurs by the specified date, and no referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources by the specified date. If such a referendum meeting these criteria does occur by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. question.body:

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) California holds a referendum on gun control measures and (b) Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate at a rally in New York City?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location. question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

3. The new main office must be functioning in Austin, Texas, with essential executive roles transferred.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google will face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024, and (b) No major cybersecurity company will fully relocate its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, this condition is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For this condition to be met:
1. No official announcement of a completed relocation by any major cybersecurity company or its leadership is made.
2. Such an announcement is not reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters is not operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions not transferred.
Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will be sufficient for this condition to be met. If the move is completed and operational by this date, this condition is not met.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the UK economy has not fallen into a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is characterized, for this question, as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The outcome will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two back-to-back quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

1. The legislation must pertain to economic matters, including fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary policies.
2. It should be approved by the House of Lords, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be distinctly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets in relation to its possible effect on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but fails to meet all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Apple finalizes a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024, and (b) the UK's House of Lords fails to pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:
   1. No bill related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, is passed by the House of Lords.
   2. If any bill is passed, it must not meet one or more of the following criteria:
      - It is not explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Sunak or his administration, as reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
      - It is not described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as YES.

The question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are true. If either one or both are false, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual members of the Bank of Israel will not be considered for resolution. question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) large protests in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts, and (b) the Central Bank of Israel not announcing an interest rate cut?

To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, this part will resolve as NO. (b) The Central Bank of Israel does not officially announce a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, on or before July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates a growth in North American demand for its Tostitos brand relative to the demand figures from the second quarter of 2023. This increase must be substantiated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and corroborated by a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). (b) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo does not report an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The absence of an increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. If both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a court rule on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). If no such ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court without a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires a ruling to be made on the matter of liability.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia formally declares a reduction in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. Education Department has successfully implemented a plan to offer payment holidays for student loan borrowers. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the U.S. Education Department or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The plan must be a new initiative aimed at offering payment holidays for a significant number of student loan borrowers. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the plan is blocked by further legal challenges, this part resolves as NO. (2) The Reserve Bank of Australia does not officially announce a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The resolution will be based on the absence of any official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reports by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) confirming a rate cut. If there is no formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting about a rate cut, this part resolves as YES. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Only if both (1) and (2) are satisfied will the overall question resolve as YES.

The endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, this condition is not met. Note that this condition does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered. (b) President Joe Biden does not deliver a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The absence of such a speech must be confirmed by the lack of official White House announcements and the absence of reports from at least two reputable news sources. If such a speech occurs by the resolution date, this condition is not met. The question resolves as NO if either or both conditions are not met by the resolution date.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in San Diego by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Diego, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a San Diego rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: (a) The E. coli outbreak tied to beef will result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 31, 2024. Official reports must confirm these deaths, attributing them to the E. coli outbreak linked to beef from a specific supplier. Confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The deaths must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. question.title: Will Washington maintain its $16 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Washington remains at $16 per hour or higher. The wage must be confirmed through official Washington state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $16 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Washington state law.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceeds 7.0% by August 2024, and (b) Washington reduces its $16 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers before July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) At any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. The rate must surpass 7.0%, not merely equal it. (b) At any point before July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Washington is reduced below $16 per hour. question.title: Will Tennessee hold a referendum on labor laws by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Tennessee officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on reforming labor laws in the state. The referendum question must directly address the issue of labor laws. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. 1. Google resolves a major workers' strike by reaching an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

2. The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) does not publicly endorse any candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. This will be based on the absence of official UFCW statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal) confirming an endorsement.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If no such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tim Scott publicly retracts his statement about Biden's stance on criminal justice reform by August 31, 2024, and (b) Minnesota does not hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 31, 2024?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of New York officially conducts a referendum regarding the legalization of marijuana. question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) no enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This requires:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. This requires confirmation by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press) that no such code has been officially adopted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement.

The question will resolve as NO if either:

1. No such referendum occurs in Michigan by August 31, 2024, or a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

2. An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established and officially adopted by July 31, 2024, meeting the specified criteria.

If such a code that fulfills these criteria is not established and formally adopted by the resolution date, this part will be considered negative. It is crucial to emphasize that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a positive outcome; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Michigan conducts an official public vote specifically aimed at ensuring the protection of abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome: 1. question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Canadian economy avoids a recession, and (b) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income does not increase by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must not be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

(b) Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For the resolution to be considered valid:

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. (2) Andrew Bailey is no longer serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on or before July 31, 2024, for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term). question.title: Will Apple fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facebook resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) Apple does not fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) It is not officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. The lack of confirmation must be due to the funding not covering full tuition for all physics students, or only covering tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria.

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 31, 2024: (a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, and (b) Nigeria lifts its ban on cryptocurrency transactions?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

(b) The government of Nigeria officially reverses its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions or makes changes that effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's reversal or weakening should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either or both are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Indonesian economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy has not fallen into a recession. A recession is characterized for this question as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as recorded by Statistics Indonesia. The answer will be NO if the Indonesian economy goes through two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

Conversely, this inquiry will be considered negative if the Indonesian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current polio outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing polio outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. This declaration must be communicated through official channels of the company (such as press releases, statements for investors, or verified social media platforms) or covered by a minimum of two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in the AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely implied from broader hiring strategies. If such a declaration is not made by the specified deadline, or if Sony only announces intentions to keep or reduce its AI workforce, this segment will resolve as negative. Note that this segment pertains to the announcement of plans, rather than the actual execution of those plans. (2) The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate is reported to have fallen below 3.50% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of South Korea or at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Korea Herald). If the rate is reported to remain at or above 3.50% throughout August 2024, this segment will resolve as negative. The overall inquiry will resolve as affirmative only if both criteria are met.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will South Dakota hold a referendum on environmental policies by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, South Dakota officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of environmental policies. The referendum must be related to implementing significant changes in the state's environmental regulations or policies. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the South Dakota state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within New York City's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The WHO declares the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024 (b) Takeda prevents generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
   2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
   3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.
   Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively continuing to enforce its patent. This could be through not withdrawing its patent, not entering a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that prevents unrestricted generic production. Confirmation of no allowance must come from the absence of official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, indicating Takeda will allow generic production, the question resolves as NO.

The question will resolve as NO if either (a) or (b) does not occur.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). (2) The Central Bank of Nigeria does not formally declare a reduction in interest rates, with verification from official Central Bank of Nigeria communications such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. The interest rate in question pertains to the monetary policy rate. If both criteria are not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of Nigeria or the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Central Bank of Nigeria officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Central Bank of Nigeria communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The interest rate in question refers to the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Nigeria's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) The European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official ECB communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by ECB officials. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's primary tool for monetary policy. If neither announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that for both cases, the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date.

This announcement must be corroborated by official ECB communications, including press releases, statements from the Governing Council, or public speeches by ECB officials. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which serves as the ECB's primary monetary policy tool. If neither of these announcements is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. It is important to note that for both scenarios, the actual date of implementation of the rate cut may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, exceeds 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Tesla announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tesla officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 6% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Tesla only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 6% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) General Motors resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) Tesla refrains from announcing additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: 

1. General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   - The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   - The strike must last for at least one week.
   - The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
   - The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   - If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

2. Tesla does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. If Tesla only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 6% reduction without announcing new cuts, or if no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, this part resolves as YES. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) for this part to resolve as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions are met as described.

1. General Motors successfully negotiates with union workers, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this to be validated:

   - If such a resolution, meeting all these stipulations, is not achieved by the specified date, or if no major strike occurs, this part will resolve as NO.

2. Tesla does not officially declare any additional workforce reductions beyond the initially reported 6% by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) By August 31, 2024, Russia announces a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, defined by yields that meet or surpass the average of the previous five years. This success must be validated by official agricultural data from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by a minimum of three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For the purpose of this question, 'successful' means that the total output of wheat and barley is at least 5% higher than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these standards, or if there is insufficient information to reach a conclusion, the question will be resolved as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government makes an official announcement regarding plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently in the works. This announcement must originate from an official governmental body, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and must be reported by at least two significant international news agencies (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The statement must explicitly express a plan to construct more reactors beyond the two already proposed, rather than merely expanding or modifying the existing plans. If no such announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reiterates or updates the current two-reactor plan, the question will be resolved as NO.

para_P.title: Could it happen that by the middle of 2024, one of the following occurs: (a) Russia announces a successful winter yield for wheat and barley or (b) Russia expresses plans to build additional nuclear power plants?
para_P.body: This question will be answered YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) By August 31, 2024, Russia declares a successful winter yield for wheat and barley, which is defined as having outputs that meet or exceed the average of the last five years. This success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). In this context, 'successful' indicates that the combined production of wheat and barley is at least 5% greater than the five-year average. If the winter yield does not meet these criteria, or if there is not enough information to make a determination, the answer will be NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government issues an official statement regarding the intention to construct more nuclear reactors in addition to the two currently planned. This statement must come from an official governmental source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and must be reported by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate a plan to build additional reactors beyond the two already proposed, rather than just expanding or modifying the existing proposals. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, or if the announcement only reiterates or updates the current two-reactor plan, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in France cancels over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024 (b) The United Nations Development Programme does not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, this condition is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. If no announcement is made, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this condition is met. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) By August 2024, a prominent healthcare system in France will eliminate over €250 million in medical debt (b) The United Nations Development Programme will refrain from declaring new funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?

The debt relief should focus on patients who are deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to pay. If the debt relief is not finalized or officially acknowledged by the designated date, or if the amount forgiven is €250 million or less, this requirement is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not publicly declare new funding commitments that total more than $400 million. If no declaration is made, or if the total of new funding commitments does not surpass $400 million, this requirement is satisfied. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two credible news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new projects or significant expansions of existing initiatives, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Both requirements (a) and (b) must be fulfilled for this inquiry to resolve as YES. If either requirement is not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, Google has officially acknowledged the termination of no fewer than 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must be derived from official company statements, regulatory documents, or coverage by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-oriented restructuring plan revealed in 2023. If Google announces a lesser number of terminations, or if no confirmation that meets these requirements is provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE. Partial terminations or staged processes that do not achieve the 1,800 employee minimum by the resolution date will also lead to a FALSE resolution.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents.
